did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle: The University of Arizona Desert Riders records 1931-1951
did.abstract: The University of Arizona Desert Riders was a women's honorary riding club, formed in 1921, using horses on loan from the University of Arizona R.O.T.C Cavalry Unit. The club was disbanded in 1944, when the horses were sold at auction by the university. The collection includes typescript constitution, minutes of meetings (1931-1947), lists of members, historical sketch, and miscellaneous related material.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: University of Arizona Libraries, Special Collections

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Women's honorary riding club, formed in 1921, using horses on loan from the University of Arizona R.O.T.C Cavalry Unit. The club was disbanded in 1944, when the horses were sold at auction by the university.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Typescript constitution, minutes of meetings (1931-1947), lists of members, historical sketch, and miscellaneous related material.
